Description: A narrow calcite vase-shaped pendant of circular section: tapering to a pointed base. The object is pierced horizontally at the top for suspension.
Curator's comments: An identical example made of black limestone was found by Brunton in a grave at Matmar (see G. Brunton, ‘Matmar’ (London, 1948), pl. XXII, 72: Brunton's 'Protodynastic, S. D. 77-8'). Bibliography: G. Brunton, 'British Museum expedition to Middle Egypt, 1929-1931 Matmar' (London, 1948), pl. XXII, 72 (Early First Dynasty); C. Andrews, 'Amulets of Ancient Egypt' (London 1994), p.95.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (161)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
